questions: You've been trying to get access to the sales team's client database for months, but it's restricted to senior staff. Your coworker just got promoted to a role that includes database access. They text you asking if you want to grab lunch to celebrate. How do you respond?

Your wealthy uncle, who you haven't visited in two years, just called to say he's been feeling lonely since his wife passed. He mentioned he's meeting with his estate lawyer next month to update his will. He asks if you could start visiting on Sundays. What do you say?

You've been trying to get face time with the VP of Engineering for months but can't get on her calendar. A junior developer who reports directly to her asks if you'd be willing to mentor themâ€”they admire your work and want to learn. How do you approach this?

You're about to apply for a permit to expand your home business, which requires approval from the neighborhood zoning board. Your neighbor, who you've never spoken to, mentions at the mailbox that she chairs that board. She invites you to her holiday party next week. How do you respond?

Your former classmate, who you lost touch with years ago, just got hired as the executive assistant to a VC partner you've been trying to pitch. She reaches out saying she'd love to reconnect over coffee. What do you do?
